newsitem.title: USA: Mistic owner buys Snapple from Quaker for $300 million.
newsitem.headline: Mistic owner buys Snapple from Quaker for $300 million.

text.p: Triarc Companies Inc., owner of the Mistic and Royal Crown soft drink brands, said Thursday it agreed to buy Quaker Oats Co.'s troubled Snapple drinks unit for $300 million in cash.

Snapple's ready-to-drink teas and juice drinks are a leader in the premium beverage market, with 1996 sales of about $550 million, but the unit has lost money since Quaker bought it on Dec. 6, 1994, for $1.7 billion.
